creditline: Gift of Daniel Greenberg and Susan Steinhauser
description: clear glass lidded vessel; wide, bulbous foot; vessel has high shoulder with inward flare toward mouth; inverted bell-shaped cover; clear glass with engraving overall--Art Deco-style patterns, band of repeated stick figures along mouth and band of stick figure-like men standing on stools, flying bird-shaped kites
marks:
Signature and Inscription

see Signed on bottom, incised: [E21 / Dailey]
text: Mysteriously clad men contort themselves while flying kites--quite an unconventional scene for a formal-looking vessel. Dailey brings humor and historical references to this glass piece, though his subject matter is contemporary. The clear glass body with engraved decoration references 1930s Swedish glass vases, and the wrapping of the vase with figures engaged in various activites relates to ancient Greek pottery (you can see examples in Gallery 241 nearby). Daileyâ€™s background ranging from commercial glass design to founding the studio glass department at the Massachusetts College of Art has allowed him to combine technical proficiency with artistic playfulness.
title: Men Flying Kites
